project_description: A simple Flutter app that toggles between displaying 'Cat' with a clock icon and 'Dog' with a person icon when the text is clicked.
architecture_overview: The project uses the Cubit pattern for state management, with a clear separation of concerns between UI, state management, and data models. The app is highly modularized with a focus on readability and maintainability.

sequence_diagram:
@startuml
actor User
participant AnimalText
participant AnimalCubit
User -> AnimalText: Tap text
AnimalText -> AnimalCubit: toggleAnimal()
AnimalCubit --> AnimalText: emit new state
Note right of AnimalText: UI updates to show new animal text and icon
@enduml
state_management_flow: The AnimalCubit manages the state of the animal text. When the user taps the text, the AnimalText widget calls the toggleAnimal method in AnimalCubit, which toggles the state between Cat and Dog. The UI updates automatically in response to state changes.
navigation_flow: The app has a single screen, so there is no navigation structure. The main screen displays the AnimalText widget, which interacts with the AnimalCubit to manage state changes.
